Miles Sound System SDK 6.1c

AIL_set_3D_orientation

The function AIL_set_3D_orientation specifies the orientation of a 3D sample, the listener, or a 3D object.

void AIL_set_3D_orientation(
  H3DPOBJECT obj,
  F32 X_face,
  F32 Y_face,
  F32 Z_face,
  F32 X_up,
  F32 Y_up,
  F32 Z_up
);

In Parameters

obj
indicates the 3D sample, the listener, or the 3D object to set the orientation of.
X_face
indicates the X coordinate of the facing vector.
Y_face
indicates the Y coordinate of the facing vector.
Z_face
indicates the Z coordinate of the facing vector.
X_up
indicates the X coordinate of the upward vector.
Y_up
indicates the Y coordinate of the upward vector.
Z_up
indicates the Z coordinate of the upward vector.

Discussion

Orientation is specified with two vectors. The facing vector tells which direction the object is facing (where his nose is pointing), and the upward vector is the vector pointing upward out of the top of the 3D object (out the top of the listener's head, for example).

The facing vector and upward vector should always be at 90 degree right angles to each other.

Following DirectSound3D's somewhat awkward lead, Miles uses the left-handed coordinate system. All of DirectX also uses left-handed coordinates, so passing in coordinates from a DirectX application is simple. OpenGL, on the other hand, cleanly uses right-handed coordinates, so you must invert the sign of the Z parameter before passing it into Miles.

Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C
